main event: A bright green, oblong object was observed weaving back and forth and making quick, darting motions over Oklahoma City, Oklahoma on May 15, 1957.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be moving at a speed of 1,200 mph.
The sighting was characteristic of a satellite or aerial device, with both visual and radar observations.
On May 26, 1957, an object was observed that appeared to hit an invisible object and split into two, falling straight to the earth.
The observers included a scout-tower operator and two airline captains at Will Rogers Field in Oklahoma City.
The possibility that the sighting was caused by a shooting meteor was suggested by the senior director.
witnesses: civilian, including a scout-tower operator and two airline captains
